item.title: Portfolio
item.description: Build up a Portfolio Your Task Step 1 - Build up your speech. Choose one of the issues studied in this unit: a) the role of editors, b) the importance of neutrality or c) the fight against disinformation. Choose 3 documents. One we have studied in the classroom, one from this page and one from your own research. All three must illustrate the issue chosen. Prepare your presentation: show how these documents relate to the topic you chose.

item.title: Neutrality
item.description: An Impossible Neutrality? A bias problem Working towards a solution - Watch the video and define the issue presented - Say why other studies on the gender gap seemed inaccurate to Amanda Menking - List the different reasons why there might be so few women editors on WP - Describe the solutions proposed to fix the gender gap on WP and say why the issue is so critical.

item.title: Fakenews
item.description: Combatting Fake News "Wikipedia Founder Says Internet Users Are Adrift In The ‘Fake News’ Era" (NPR, 2018). Your browser does not support the audio element. Listen and sum up Jimmy Wales's opinion about the internet. Find out what is specific about the Wikipedia community according to Jimmy Wales. Discuss this statement: "Aren't the people who are fighting for factual accuracy going to be forever outgunned? "There's a lot Wikipedia can teach us about fighting disinformation Read the article and sum up Wikipedia's three strength in fighting disinformation.
